answers.answer: aww so sorry you feel so bad ..I am wondering if you are taking any other meds ,any anti biotics etc..or whether it may be the meds you take for diabetes I say this as I have had some bad reactions from  prescribed meds one called Bactrim in particular .Has there been any change in anything ?

question: Hi everyone ,It's my first time posting here ... Just wanted to get some insight or maybe some perspective of what possibly could be going on - a little background , I'm 35 type 1 diabetic on a insulin pump .For the past week and a half I've been extremely tired ( more than usual ) the front of my chest in between my breasts hurts , almost like I've been punched in the chest , it's sore , hurts when I breath , move , just generally a very painful uncomfortable feeling , I've been experiencing bouts of dizziness , like a vertigo feeling , yesterday while at the post office , it came on so suddenly I thought I was going to pass out , luckily I hung onto the counter took a few deep breaths , and was able to leave and come home & lay down ..I'm not one to rush to the doctor for every little thing .. But I'm a little concerned right now .. I have no fever , so the main things that are concerning me Is, uncomfortable pain in the chest , tired & dizziness ... Any help would be greatThank you :)
title: Tired , dizziness , chest pain
